body_html: I ran into this exact same issue when I was running https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/tools/run_tests.sh#L24 with CUDA enabled, although there is no error if the CUDA path is avoided and THCRandom_init is not called. I wondered if this is Valgrind's incompatibility with CUDA?
body_text: I ran into this exact same issue when I was running https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/tools/run_tests.sh#L24 with CUDA enabled, although there is no error if the CUDA path is avoided and THCRandom_init is not called. I wondered if this is Valgrind's incompatibility with CUDA?
body: I ran into this exact same issue when I was running https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/tools/run_tests.sh#L24 with CUDA enabled, although there is no error if the CUDA path is avoided and `THCRandom_init` is not called. I wondered if this is Valgrind's incompatibility with CUDA?
